column5: It was a very successful day for the Muskie Opener on Lake St. Clair.  I can't post the pictures here (because they're not mine to post)  But have a look.  http://www.bluewaterbridge.com/viewtopic.php?p=751
beautiful fish.. maybe i'll hook into some this summer...
A nice brute, I always like seeing St Clair muskies they have origional markings. I could have told you were they were from without knowing, lol.
Now that's the pics I've been waiting to see.   Attaboy Patches.
Most musky in St. Clair are Great Lakes (spotted) Muskellunge were as musky in the Kawarthas are Northern Muskellunge. The cross between the 2 look really cool.
Yep, lot's of good ones, I only get to see the ugly GB ones that are almost white or dark green but they always got big red eyes.  never see any spotted ones on the bay.
Have a few pics of spotted Musky from Georgian bay.   Sorry! No Scanner though.  Very Nice fish GUYS!!!
Awesome markings on those muskies, great pics.  Kev

Way to go!!!  I seen that Paul (Fisheye) got the big one.....Woodies are the bait for slimmers on St. Clair that's a fact!!!  From what I heard you guys did the best out of all the musky hunters that day!!!  Congrats!!!   Chrispy!
